title: Secure User Authentication with Multi-Factor Login
summary: Enable customers to access the portal securely using multi-factor authentication.
description: This epic focuses on building a secure customer authentication mechanism for the self-service banking portal. It includes features like standard username–password login, multi-factor authentication (MFA) using OTP, biometric, or device-based validation, and safe session handling. Encryption in transit and at rest, along with adherence to industry security standards, ensures customer credentials and financial data remain protected against unauthorized access.

title: Responsive and Accessible Interface Design
summary: Design a user-friendly, responsive, and accessible interface for all devices.
description: This epic covers the development of a responsive web design that provides a consistent experience on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. The interface will be optimized for performance and accessibility standards to ensure easy navigation by all users. This includes consistent layouts, adaptive components, and fast page loads across browsers, improving the overall look, feel, and usability of the portal.

title: Personalized Dashboard and Profile-Driven Services
summary: Develop a personalized user dashboard based on customer profile and eligibility.
description: This epic delivers a dynamic dashboard that presents personalized account information, available banking products, and service options based on each user's profile and eligibility. The dashboard will fetch customer-specific data from backend systems and display insights such as balances, account summaries, shortcuts to frequent actions, and relevant notifications. This ensures each customer interacts with tailored content that meets their needs.

title: Digital Account Opening and Service Workflows
summary: Allow customers to open accounts and request service modifications online.
description: This epic introduces flexible workflows that enable customers to open new accounts, modify existing ones, and request additional banking services directly from the portal. It will streamline the process into a few guided steps, prefill known user data, and validate entries on the fly. Integrated verification and approval workflows will ensure compliance while minimizing user effort for completing service requests.

title: Save and Resume Applications
summary: Enable users to save partially completed form data and resume later.
description: This epic focuses on allowing users to save incomplete applications or request forms as drafts and return to complete them later. Saved data will be encrypted and securely stored so that users can continue from where they left off without data loss. The implementation will also include visual indicators for incomplete steps and expiration logic for pending submissions to maintain data validity.

title: Document Upload and Management
summary: Provide a secure feature for uploading required documents during the request process.
description: This epic allows customers to upload necessary documents directly through the portal for account openings or service modifications. It will include validation for file formats and sizes, encrypted storage, and secure access controls for reviewing uploaded items. The system will display progress indicators and support document resubmission where required, ensuring compliance with the bank’s document handling policies.

title: Real-Time Status Tracking and Notifications
summary: Provide real-time tracking and notification alerts for submitted requests.
description: This epic provides customers with real-time visibility into the progress of their account openings or service modification requests. A dedicated request tracker will update dynamically as processes advance through backend systems. Automated notifications through email and in-portal messages will inform customers about key milestones such as receipt confirmations, approvals, or rejections, improving transparency and communication.

title: Comprehensive History and Interaction Log
summary: Maintain and display a full history of all user actions and transactions.
description: This epic ensures all interactions made through the portal—such as login activities, requests, applications, and uploaded documents—are logged comprehensively for both the customer and administrators. Customers can easily view their activity history, while the backend retains auditable records for compliance and dispute resolution. This persistent logging will form part of the audit trail and security analytics framework.

title: Core Banking System Integration
summary: Integrate portal workflows with the bank’s existing core systems for real-time processing.
description: This epic covers the development of secure API integrations and messaging systems that connect the self-service portal with the bank’s core banking infrastructure. It allows for bidirectional data exchange, real-time balance checks, transaction updates, and status synchronization. The integration will follow strict data security, validation, and logging standards to maintain system consistency, accuracy, and reliability.

title: Independent Portal Database and Performance Optimization
summary: Design an independent database for optimized responsiveness and data handling.
description: This epic involves building a dedicated and optimized database tailored for the portal’s operations. It will independently manage user sessions, forms, documents, and interaction records while maintaining periodic synchronization with the bank’s core system. Performance enhancements, caching mechanisms, and database indexing will ensure minimal latency and consistent speed, even under high user load scenarios.

title: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Implementation
summary: Implement secure access restrictions based on user roles and permissions.
description: This epic introduces a role-based access control framework to ensure that users can only access functionalities permitted by their authorization levels. It will include role definitions for customers, administrators, and support agents with granular permissions for data interaction. The RBAC model ensures compliance with internal controls and regulatory standards, protecting sensitive data and reducing the risk of unauthorized actions.
